channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid: Doctor blames misinformation for hospital admissions rise
item.description: A critical care consultant says some hospitals were at their busiest for months last weekend.

item.title: Blaenavon man crushed to death under car while stealing part
item.description: Daniel Stephens, 25, needed money for a court case to get access to his children, an inquest heard.

item.title: Bangor business park to be sold by Welsh government after 21 years
item.description: £11m has been spent on land at a business park which has been unused since 2000.

item.title: Covid: Teen in hospital with virus urges others to get vaccinated
item.description: Maisy Evans, 17, is in hospital and is so short of breath she can barely talk.

item.title: Bute Park attack: Gary Jenkins died from brain injury, inquest hears
item.description: Three people have been charged with the murder of Dr Gary Jenkins after an alleged park attack.

item.title: Leeds complete signing of Wales winger James
item.description: Leeds sign Wales international winger Daniel James from Manchester United, more than two years after he almost joined the club on loan.

item.title: Pembroke Dock: Dale Morgan admits killing his mother
item.description: Dale Morgan pleads guilty to murdering Judith Rhead in a house in Pembroke Dock.

item.title: Covid contact Moore ruled out of Wales games
item.description: Kieffer Moore will miss all three of Wales' upcoming games after he was deemed a close contact of Adam Davies, who has tested positive for Covid-19.

item.title: Covid: Theatres wary despite first capacity audience since pandemic
item.description: Jimmy Carr's show is set to be the first capacity indoor audience in Wales since the pandemic began.

item.title: One season of rugby affects brain, says study
item.description: One season of professional rugby could be enough to see a decline in a player's blood flow to the brain and cognitive function, a new study claims.

item.title: Connah's Quay woman accused of murder pleads not guilty
item.description: Emma Berry is charged with killing Dean Michael Bennett in May.

item.title: Gower gig paused to request lifeboat crew after woman stung by fish
item.description: Frontman Jon Tarrant told the crowd: "You're about to see a real-life lifeboat shout in action."

item.title: Knife crime: Cardiff stabbings prompt government help call from MP
item.description: Three men are in hospital after two unrelated stabbing incidents in Cardiff over the weekend.

item.title: Rugby: Mixed ability club in Llanelli marks 25 years
item.description: About half of the club's players are registered disabled and most have learning disabilities.

item.title: Stormzy, Skepta and Aitch: Making beats for rap stars at 19
item.description: Chris Rich has made thousands from creating beats in the style of hip hop's elite.

item.title: Payday lenders: 'They are robbing the vulnerable'
item.description: Within months of his first £150 payday loan, Tom owed £6,000 to 10 lenders.

item.title: Snowdon: Amputee crawls up mountain to raise funds for children
item.description: It will be the first time Paul Ellis has made his way up a mountain after losing his legs in 2008.

item.title: North Wales tourism has strained communities, authority says
item.description: Snowdonia National Park Authority said numbers visiting brought benefits and challenges.

item.title: Scrapping theory tests could cut HGV driver shortage, says instructor
item.description: One lorry driving instructor said it can take up to 16 months to train up new drivers.

item.title: Connor Roberts: Burnley sign Wales defender from Swansea
item.description: Burnley sign Wales international defender Connor Roberts from Swansea for an undisclosed fee.

item.title: Ollie Cooper and Jake Cain: Newport County sign Swansea City and Liverpool midfielders on loan
item.description: Newport County sign Swansea City's Ollie Cooper and Liverpool's Jake Cain on season-long loans.

item.title: Aaron Ramsey: Juventus midfielder one of five injury withdrawals from Wales squad
item.description: Juventus midfielder Aaron Ramsey, David Brooks, Joe Rodon, Neco Williams and George Thomas withdraw from the Wales squad against Finland, Belarus and Estonia.

item.title: Wrexham 1-1 Notts County: Paul Mullin rescues Dragons against Magpies
item.description: Paul Mullin's header deservedly earns a point for Wrexham after Kyle Wootton had given visiting Notts County the lead.

item.title: Wayne Routledge: Veteran forward says Swansea City playing career is over
item.description: Veteran forward Wayne Routledge announces that his time as a Swansea City player is over.

item.title: Mwy o bobl ifanc yn ysbyty oherwydd camwybodaeth Covid
item.description: Mae ymgynghorydd gofal critigol wedi dweud bod staff yn 'ddigalon' wrth weld wardiau'n llenwi eto.

item.title: Gall rygbi proffesiynol 'am un tymor' effeithio'r ymennydd
item.description: Fe wnaeth ymchwilwyr ddilyn un tîm proffesiynol am flwyddyn, a gweld dirywiad ym mhob chwaraewr.

item.title: Dyn yn pledio'n euog i lofruddio'i fam yn Sir Benfro
item.description: Cafwyd hyd i gorff Judith Rhead, 68, mewn eiddo yn Noc Penfro ym mis Chwefror eleni.

item.title: Canrif ers geni Raymond Williams
item.description: Yr Athro Daniel Williams sy'n trafod un o feddylwyr mwyaf dylanwadol y chwith

item.title: Gêm gartref gyntaf Wrecsam o'r tymor yn gyfartal
item.description: Doedd perchnogion enwog newydd y clwb ddim ar y Cae Ras ar gyfer y gêm yn erbyn Notts County.
